title: The Two Paths
opening: Abiding by the armistice brokered by Arion and Linoan, the Liberation Army withdrew from Tarrah. Their next goal was a matter of some debate: the Freeblades of Fiana and the Magi wished to make for Castle Munster and liberate it first, while the nobles of Leonster and the sellswords of Tarrah favored liberating Castle Leonster first. Ultimately, pragmatism prevailed, as it was agreed that seizing Leonster first was more advantageous to the army's mobility. However, as they neared Solwood Pass, Leif would soon have to make another strategic decision...

intro.speaker: Dryas
intro.line: Prince Leif, a moment, if I may? I would advise heading west at Solwood Pass to reach the road to Nordrhein.

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: And it is on this matter that Duke Dryas and I are of different minds. I instead argue heading east at the pass. That route will allow us to attack Leonster from the south, where the Empire's defenses are sure to be weaker.

intro.speaker: Dryas
intro.line: Clearly you aren't well-acquainted with the area. If you were, you'd know that Millefeuille Forest lies to Leonster's south. The place is synonymous with folk getting lost and never returning! Hell, the locals even call it "Mirage Forest" for short!

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Don't patronize me. I'm well aware of the dangers—but so is the Empire. They won't be expecting an attack to come from such a treacherous area. With our smaller numbers, making clever use of the terrain is our only hope of victory. That's just basic tactics!

intro.speaker: Dryas
intro.line: I must strenuously object! All of Thracia—no, all of Jugdral is watching our battle! This is about more than victory! We cannot merely win, we must win in such a way that gives inspiration and hope to the masses oppressed by the Empire! Are we to skulk through the woods like common bandits? Nay! We have to make a glorious spectacle of it, charging into battle with Leonster's flag held high!

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Such a spectacle would indeed be glorious—for the Empire. We'd be charging right into their front lines. Our casualties would be enormous.

intro.speaker: Dryas
intro.line: Some of our own would perish, true, but it would be an honorable death worthy of a knight of Leonster.

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Don't presume to speak for all of us, Duke Dryas. Only a small fraction of our troops are knights—many more hold no title. To them, your notion of an "honorable death" is something neither meaningful nor desirable. See that you don't get innocent men killed by projecting your own values onto them.

intro.speaker: Dryas
intro.line: Th-That's uncalled for, August! Your very words come perilously close to an insult! *Sigh* Though I suppose there's little point to us arguing further. The decision rests with Prince Leif now.

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: ...Indeed it does. We shall do as the prince commands.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Boss, Boss! I gots a great idea! Let's hit up that there village today!

intro.speaker: Zile
intro.line: What, that old slum? It's just a couple lean-tos and an outhouse. They don't got nuthin' worth stealin'. Heh, burnin' the place down might actually be an improvement fer them villagers.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: They might not got anything valuable, but they DO got girls. Real pretty girls. We could just snatch 'em up and sell 'em to slavers! It'd be an easy payday!

intro.speaker: Zile
intro.line: Huh... You might be onto something, young'un! All right, let's do it! Move out, boys! Round up all the ladyfolk and kill everybody else!

battle.speaker: Amalda
battle.line: Wonders never cease... That band of soldiers has come to the village's rescue. The gods may yet be merciful... Now, it's high time I returned to my own soldiers.

recruit-talk.speaker: Leif
recruit-talk.line: Are you a sellsword hired by the village?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ralf
recruit-talk.line: Depends what you mean. I'm fighting for the village, but I sure don't remember gettin' paid by 'em. Not that I woulda taken their gold even if they had offered me any. Couldn't take coin from the needy.

recruit-talk.speaker: Leif
recruit-talk.line: Then why fight on their behalf?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ralf
recruit-talk.line: I stumbled across this place in the middle of my own little journey and they lent me a hand. Time to return the favor, that's all. Not that it's any of your business, ya little brat. Just who are you supposed to be, anyway?

recruit-talk.speaker: Leif
recruit-talk.line: Ah, my apologies. I shouldn't have started prying without introducing myself first. I'm Leif of Leonster.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ralf
recruit-talk.line: Leif...? H-How...?! Are you THE Leif, the prince? Talk about being in the right place at the right time! See, I'm Ralf, an' I'm not much more than a lowly sellsword, myself. If it's all right with you, Prince, could I join your army?

recruit-talk.speaker: Leif
recruit-talk.line: Of course! We could always use more men like you. Though if I may, I'd like to ask you something. Why exactly do you want to join my army? What's your reason?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ralf
recruit-talk.line: Because I won't put up with living under the Empire's thumb for one moment longer. That good enough of a reason?

recruit-talk.speaker: Leif
recruit-talk.line: I... can't say I disagree, so that suffices for me, yes. Ralf, my greatest desire is to free every person suffering under the Empire's tyranny. Do you swear to fight for that cause?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ralf
recruit-talk.line: Sure do! Leave it to me!

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: Hold! Who are you?! Another one of the Empire's lapdogs?!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: How uncouth... If you wish to live, turn your blade aside. I didn't learn the technique of Astra just to waste it on cutting down clueless little girls like you.

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: Astra? B-But that's the secret art of the Isaachian royal family...! That would make you—

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: Correct. It is I, Prince Shannan of Isaach. But I've been forced to hide my identity, so do us both a favor and forget you ever saw me.

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: Prince Shannan! I would ask something of you!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: Hrk! K-Keep your voice down, would you? Let's avoid any surprises, shall we?

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: Please, you must teach me some of your swordplay! I beg of you! It doesn't have to be a prolonged lesson. Just knowing the secret of how to perform Astra would be enough...

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: Please, Prince Shannan! I want—no, I NEED to become stronger! No matter what, I must grow stronger...!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: W-Well, I could take you through the motions, I suppose...

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: Would you? Oh, I'd be in your debt!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: (Oof, this has gone from bad to worse. Guess I'll just ramble off some vague nonsense about swordsmanship...)

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: Knowing the movements of the technique is important, of course, but more important is your spirit, your heart. When the swiftness of your body becomes one with the sharpness of your mind, only then are you capable of learning Astra.

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: My body and my mind...?

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: Indeed. Now, to begin with, make a simple swing with your sword.

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: But how should I swing it, exactly? Could you demonstrate? Just once?

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: Uhhh... N-No, that would defeat the whole point. Astra can only be mastered through your own attempts to understand it. If I were to demonstrate it, all you would learn is how to imitate me. (Yeah, that sounded good...)

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: So that's how it is, huh...? All right. I'll just try something, then. Hee-yah!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: No, not like that! You're doing it completely wrong!

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: Haaa-yah!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: No, no! Now you're just flailing your sword around like you're blindfolded! It's about using your body and mind together, remember? Your body is working, but your mind isn't in it! (Lady, I am sellin' you a bill of goods here...)

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: Focus my mind into my body... Focus my mind into my body... HAAA-YAH!

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: W-Was that...? I can't believe it...!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: ...No way...

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: No, that can't be it! It isn't really THAT easy, is it, Prince Shannan?

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: Huh? Oh, well, uh... Of course not, my pupil! You couldn't call that a perfected Astra!

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: That's what I thought. I mean, that hardly took any time at all...

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: A-At any rate, I promised to show you the motions, and I've made good on my word. I'll be taking my leave now.

battle-talk.speaker: Mareeta
battle-talk.line: Thank you for everything, Prince Shannan! Focus my mind into my body... Focus my body into my mind...

battle-talk.speaker: Shannam
battle-talk.line: (Maaan, what was up with that girl?)

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: Good heavens, what a day this has been... Ah! You're the strangers that came to our village's aid, are you not? I wish to thank your leader personally. Where might they be?

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: My goodness, we owe you and your forces quite the debt... Your decision to aid us is the only reason any of us still draw breath. Please accept this gift as a token of our gratitude.

visit.speaker: Leif
visit.line: Thank you, Bishop. If you'll excuse us, my men and I must be on our way.

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: Where are you headed, might I ask?

visit.speaker: Bishop
visit.line: Is that so? I've a favor to ask of you, then. A disciple of mine, Sleuf, left here on... something of a personal journey. If you happen to cross paths, do send word that the lad is all right. That said, I offer to send you partway there with my Warp staff. I can teleport you to one of two places: The first is Millefeuille Forest, which is to the south of Leonster. Be warned: there's a reason it has the nickname "Mirage Forest." The second is Nordrhein, the coastline that runs east all the way to Leonster. But you'd have to breach the fort the Empire has there. Which way shall I send you?

boss.speaker: Zile
boss.line: Heheheh... You wanna square off with me, do ya?

end.speaker: Dryas
end.line: This way leads to Nordrhein, which will take us east along the coast to Leonster. Seasoned Imperial troops will be on the lookout for us. I anticipate the battle will be a difficult one indeed. Is this your will, sire?

end.speaker: August
end.line: This path shall take us through the deep woodlands of Millefeuille Forest, better known as the infamous "Mirage Forest." We would encounter little resistance, but there may well be unforeseen hazards we have yet to discover. Shall we proceed, my prince?
